name: K2-322
scenarioDescription:
The K2-322 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-322 is a star with 0.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.6 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-322 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-322 system


K2-322 b

K2-322 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-322 b is 4.3566 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-322 b is 1.92 that of Earth. At 4.3566 Earth masses, K2-322 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-322, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
